reviewText: There is little I can say about AMG without running off a tangent of sheer gushing.  This is one of my top 3 anime, ever.  Funny, emotional, drama where it's necessary, and nothing "slapstick" holding it back or forcing it to become silly.  Even if you're an anime fan of only one particular genre, and it isn't remotely something like AMG, I believe almost anyone will enjoy it.  For me, there is simply nothing at all negative to say, anywhere in the series.  It is absolutely remarkable!
summary: Superb.  Remarkable. Dare I say, Perfect?!! (Yeah, I think so!!)
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this set based on reviews of others on Amazon.  I was snoozing through the Bounto arc for Bleach, Naruto Shippuden had yet to debut, I was cranking through Death Note and I was annoyed that I'd never see a resolution to Inuyasha.  So, I needed something new and something a little more sweet and girlie (I am after all, a girl.)Without ever having seen an episode, I purchased this box set along with the OVA and movie on a whim - a spontaneous splurge.  I watched the OVA first and became familiar with the characters and premise, thought it was cute but not brilliant.  Watched the movie and REALLY enjoyed that (thought I could convince the guys I watch the other shows with to watch AMG if they saw the movie.) Then I sat down one afternoon when I was home sick from work and watched the entire box set of Ah! My Goddess in one sitting.  I loved it!  The first few episodes cover basically the same thing as the OVA with some changes and IMO more smoothly than the OVA.I loved watching a world of great characters in their silly day to day lives, interacting, being cute. It's like reliving a combination of your first real crush and your only true love all at once.  There's not really enough action in the first few episodes to keep my guy friends interested, but there's a lot there for those that like romantic comedy and it picks up some action as the season progresses.  I've watched it in both English and Japanese with subtitles.  I prefer the Japanese, but the English dub isn't bad.I can't wait for the next season's box set release!

reviewText: A very good series.  It differs from the plot of the first, but since it is so different, it is like watching a different series, not a rewrite of the first video set.  It only has two real bad points.  1) the opening and closing music is awful, whereas the first series had wonderful opening and closing tunes.  This set sounds like a Japanese version of 'Riverdance' blended with country and western. 2) Belldandy has a very woodenly drawn face.  The voice was all right, but the expression never changes to show changes of emotion to match.
summary: Almost as good as the first.

reviewText: This is the box set of Ah My Goddess season 1, consisting 6 DVDs. Each DVD has been released with seperate names previously. Vol 1: Always forever, Vol 2: Love plus one..... Vol 5: In your eyes, Vol 6 Last dance. In Japan, AMG season 2 was broadcasted in spring and summer 2006. In US, the season 2 is not released yet (so far Dec. 2006). There are also 3 related versions of Ah (Oh) my Goddess series, which share the same characters but diverging storylines. Ah My Goddess Movie is 1 DVD, standing alone with somewhat serious storyline and good music. Oh My Goddess OVA is 2 or 3 DVDs (different for release times) with the same 5 episodes. This OMG OVA is the first production of Goddess series actually. The Adventures of Mini Goddess is comic version of the series consisting 4 DVDs with 7~9 minut short episodes.
summary: AMG Season 1 Box Set of 6 DVD
